trait.name: Peaceful Aura, Fearsome Presence
entries: Beipiaosaurus is a docile creature, calmly feeding on vegetation in the chilly mountains of Yixian. However, if attacked, Beipiaosaurus will erupt into a frenzy of slashing claws. The first time Beipiaosaurus is attacked, the attacking creature must succeed a {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Beipiaosaurus until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Slow Metabolism
entries: Beipiaosaurus has advantage on saving throws to prevent the {@condition poisoned} condition. However, if it does become {@condition poisoned}, the duration of that condition is doubled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Beipiaosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make two Sabre-Clawed Slash attacks.

action.name: Sabre-Clawed Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} additional slashing damage.

trait.name: Altruistic Behaviour
entries: When attacked, a herd of Bolong will tend to flee. However, one will always stay behind to buy time for the others to escape. That Bolong will attack and fight to the death. The other individuals will only fight if they are cornered or cannot escape.

trait.name: Thundering Charge
entries: If Bolong moves at least 20 ft. in a straight line before using its Crushing Bulk attack, that attack deals an additional {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage this turn, but also deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage to Bolong on a successful hit.

trait.name: Defensive Gouge
entries: If Bolong is hit by a melee attack, it may use its reaction to make a single Thumb Gouge attack at the creature that hit it.
Hadrosauroids are frequently portrayed as relatively
harmless animals that could only flee from danger.
However, any modern large herbivore can be extremely
dangerous, either because it is naturally aggressive or
because it will use its bulk to defend itself. Hadrosauroids
had thick, powerful tails which could strike attackers and
Bolong possessed a thumb spike which could be used to
fight predators (or other Bolong). Most hadrosauroids are
also thought to have been communal animals, who were
likely involved and protective parents, similar to
modern cows.
We suggest Bolong be played as an apparently peaceful
grazing animal, but with both the capacity for extreme
aggression (especially if protecting young) and sudden
panic, fleeing en-mass

action.name: Crushing Bulk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Thumb Gouge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scratch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2({@damage 1d2 +1 }) slashing damage.

trait.name: Arboreal
entries: If Microraptor uses the Dash action, do not increase its flight speed, but instead triple its climb speed. Microraptor also has advantage on Stealth checks while in a wooded or forested environment.

trait.name: Feathered and Evasive.
entries: When making a Dexterity saving throw to take half damage from an attack, spell, or effect, Microraptor instead takes no damage if the saving throw is succeeded.
